title: I wish I could be like my best friend but I don’t think I can do it
self_text: I feel bad for her because she has to do so much with her boyfriend and I just want to be there for her when she needs me, but I don’t have a boyfriend so I cannot do the same things as her. How can I support her even if we are not doing the same thing? I know that I am trying to compare myself to someone else and I shouldn’t do that.

title: You know when you’re scrolling through Reddit and suddenly feel like you need to do something else?
self_text: I just got out of a relationship that was mostly over for me, so now I don’t really have much motivation to work on myself or anything related to my life at all, but it is kinda interesting how I went from feeling like I needed to do everything with someone else (and having no idea what that would be) to being completely uninterested in doing things by myself.  So yeah, sometimes I feel like I’m stuck in an endless loop of boredom.  I’ve tried lots of stuff like meditation, exercise, reading, learning new skills, working on relationships with family members, etc. They are all helpful in certain situations, but I am still stuck in the middle of my own thoughts about my feelings, and they never seem to go anywhere. It's like I can see where things should lead but I can’t grasp them. And then when I think I am grasping them, they slip away.  Anyone else ever experience this?

title: I just want to be normal
self_text: It’s not a big deal but it always seems like everyone else is moving forward and me I’m stuck in place, I don’t know why. Can anyone relate? Or help?

title: You know you're a lonely adult when...
self_text: ...you spend your Saturday night watching a documentary about penguins.  I’m not even that into animals, but they just seem so happy and well-adjusted in their little colonies. I miss them. And my life.

title: What's the best way to get over a guy?
self_text: I recently got dumped by my boyfriend and it's been really hard for me since we were together for about 3 years and I have so many memories of him that it's kinda like he disappeared overnight, but I know that's not how life works and if I keep dwelling on it I'll probably never move on with my life and become depressed forever so I'm trying to focus on myself and get back into shape (I was a dancer when I was younger) and meet new people, but I can't seem to shake off this feeling in my heart that something is missing from my life, even though it's been months since our breakup and I'm starting to think that maybe it's just me who's stuck here and can't let go of him. Does anyone have any suggestions or advice on how to overcome this situation and finally get over my ex? Thanks.

title: I’m not sure if my ex has blocked me, or if I just can’t see her profile anymore on facebook. We had a pretty nasty breakup (I broke up with her), and she was pretty nasty about it too. We were together for a year, so there’s plenty of pictures and stuff on our profiles that we both have access to. Now that we’re broken up, I don’t think either of us want to keep any contact with the other. But anyway, I tried logging into her Facebook profile yesterday to look at some old photos, and I couldn’t get in. Today, I tried again, and I still couldn’t get in. So I assumed she had blocked me, but maybe I could get back in somehow.  So I tried logging into mine, and I noticed something weird. When I went to edit my profile, my name was changed from what it should be, to a random name and birthday that I didn't set. The picture was also changed to a random photo. I tried deleting those changes, but they kept coming back every time I tried to edit them. So I ended up leaving the page completely. Then when I came back, everything was normal again. I thought I might have been seeing something weird, and decided to leave the page completely.  I left the page completely, and then I came back later today, and everything was normal again. I’m not sure what happened, but it definitely seemed like someone else was messing around with my profile. I guess this is why I never give out my personal information online. I guess I should probably change all my passwords too.  I’m not sure what to do here. Should I report this to Facebook?  Or should I just let it go? I don’t really know. Does anyone have an idea of what might have happened?
I’m going to start playing video games again, what should I play?
self_text: I’ve been off video games for a few years now but I want to get back into them and have no idea what to play. My system is pretty much an Xbox series x.  I like single player RPGs, action rpgs, open world RPGs, pretty much anything with good story and character development.  I also enjoy action games in the style of dark souls or devil may cry.  Does anyone have any suggestions for me?

title: AITA for getting upset with my mom?
self_text: My mom has been doing some weird stuff lately, like texting me at 3 am or calling me to complain about her coworkers and how much she hates them.  I’m a bit concerned because I don’t know why she would do that and it doesn’t seem like the type of thing that someone who’s normally very calm and collected would do. I tried to talk to her about it but she got really mad and said that I was overreacting and didn’t have any right to question her decisions. At first, I just accepted it but then she started saying things like “You never understand me” and “Why can’t you be more supportive?” which is incredibly hurtful. Now I feel like I need to take a step back and observe her behavior before coming up to her again.

title: How to start a conversation with someone you like?
self_text: Hey, I’m really shy and it’s hard for me to talk to people I like.   I don't want to be creepy or make them uncomfortable but I also don't know how to start a conversation.  What are some good ways to start talking to someone you like?

title: Do you think the new patch will be as bad as they say?
self_text: I’m just wondering what the community thinks about it. I don’t want to play in a game that is as bad as they say, but I do want to play some game, and this seems like my best shot at this time. What are your thoughts on this?

title: I'm just curious, how do you guys get in to a relationship? Like what are the first steps?  I don't really know how relationships work so I wanted to ask for some advice on how to get into one.  I've been single for years and it feels like everyone else is getting in to relationships and having fun while I'm stuck here alone.
self_text: I know this might seem like a weird question, but I'm genuinely trying to learn more about relationships and how they work.  I don't have any problems with my gender or sexuality, I'm just curious as to how others would go about getting into relationships.

title: I’m feeling so lonely, is anyone else out there?
self_text: I just wanted to say that I’m still here and I can talk to you all if you want to. Just a little warning though, I am not the best at typing so it might take me a while to type back sometimes.  Also, if you want to talk about anything please do! Don’t be afraid to tell me what you think or how you feel. It will probably help me a lot too.

title: I’m nervous about meeting my boyfriend’s family for the first time.
self_text: My boyfriend has been very kind and supportive through it all, but I can tell he is just as nervous as I am. I wish there was a way to prepare without having an anxiety attack or falling apart before I even meet them.  I don’t know if they’ll be welcoming or not and that makes me so anxious to think about. I don’t want to ruin anything with my anxiety. It would be nice to feel at ease when I finally get to meet them.

self_text: I just started playing, and its pretty fun! However, some people have said that it's a time sink.  So what do you guys think?

title: I'm having a really bad day, but I don't want to talk about it
self_text: So if anyone wants to play games or chat, just let me know.  I'm not going to be on here much though, so don't get too mad if you try to contact me and I don't respond.

title: I feel like my mum is really sad about something. Should I ask her what’s wrong?
self_text: My mum has been quiet and sad all day, and she keeps staring out the window when she thinks I’m not looking at her. She has also cried once today. I don’t know why she’s so sad, but I think it might be because of me. I can’t tell if I did something wrong, but I just don’t want to upset her anymore. So I guess I should ask her what’s wrong, but I don’t know how to start a conversation with her. Any tips on how to do that?

title: You know when you’re feeling down and just want to lay in bed all day?
self_text: That’s me right now. I don’t have the energy for anything but sleep. If anyone wants to chat, feel free to do so, but if not, that’s okay too.  I just wanted to vent a little bit about how tired I am. It's been a long week, and I need to take a breather. Anyone else ever feel like this? What did you do to get through it?

self_text: My mom is being really strict about me not going on the cruise because she wants my dad to go too. Can anyone help me get out of this situation?

title: Ways to break an emotional attachment with someone you used to have a deep connection with?
self_text: I’m still trying to heal from the heartbreak, and it feels like my entire life is based on the past relationship we had.  I think that breaking the emotional attachment will take me a while, but I want to be able to move on with my life without constantly thinking about them, which is hard since they are pretty much the only thing I can focus on at the moment. Any tips or advice?  Edit: Thanks for all the replies! This is a very long process, and I do know that, but I just wanted to share my thoughts with people who might be in similar situations as well.

title: Can I make a plan to get over someone?
self_text: Hi guys, I have been dating someone for about 3 years now and she just broke up with me. She said that we need some space from each other in order to work on our relationship but I think it is best if we were never together. I feel like my life is going down the drain since she left me.  I am so lost and confused right now and I don't know how to move on from her. How can I make a plan to move on from her?

title: What is the purpose of online dating apps?
self_text: I’m just curious why people use these apps, as I haven’t used any in a while. They seem like they will only lead to disappointment.

title: You’re not the only one who is tired of these online dating games.
self_text: I get it, I get it. It’s all just a game to them. They don’t want anything real, they just want attention and validation. And honestly? That hurts more than anything else. It makes me feel like my efforts are worthless and that nothing I do will ever make them see the value in me.  I know you guys can probably relate though. If you’re out there and you’ve had enough of the same old song and dance… you’re not alone. Don’t give up on yourself. We’re here for each other. Let’s find each other some support and camaraderie.  We’re not meant to be treated like objects or commodities. We’re men. We deserve respect and affection. So let’s keep pushing back against these types of people until we stop seeing them. Let's also realize what we *do* want.  Let’s push forward together.

title: I have a crush on my best friend, but I don’t want to ruin our friendship.
self_text: Should I tell him or not?

title: I’m a guy and I want to befriend someone, but I don’t know how to start?
self_text: Can anyone give me some advice on how to approach women for friendship? I have social anxiety and it makes things difficult. It’s not that I think they’re pretty or anything like that. I just want a friend who I can talk to about my day-to-day life and stuff.  I know you guys are men so I figured maybe you could give some good advice?

title: I don’t understand why he doesn’t like me
self_text: He is my ex and we broke up a month ago. We were together for 2 years and had been dating since high school. During our time together, there were many times that he said he loved me but then would deny it later on. After our breakup, he went to therapy with the goal of finding out what was wrong with him and how he could become a better man. Turns out he has Asperger’s Syndrome which explains his odd behavior, but still… I don’t get why he says he doesn’t love me anymore or thinks I am toxic to him when I have always tried to be good for him.  I asked him if he wanted to remain friends, and he said “I don’t want to be your friend” so I gave up. I think he wants to punish me and make me feel bad. It hurts to know that someone who I once thought was my soulmate actually feels like that about me now. I have no idea why he does these things and I just wish I knew.  I wish I could go back in time and change some of the things I did because maybe then he wouldn’t feel that way about me. But I can’t and I have to live with it. What should I do? Can anyone offer advice?

title: Is it okay to tell my crush that I have a crush on them?
self_text: My name is Sarah, and I'm an 18 year old girl. I like Alex (male) so much that I wish he could see me as more than just a friend.  I want to tell him about my feelings but I'm scared if he does not feel the same way about me, our friendship would be ruined. He's also a very nice person with whom I share many things in common. I love his sense of humor, his kindness, his intelligence, etc.  How do I go about telling him? What are some good ways to start the conversation? Should I just start by telling him that I enjoy spending time with him? I know he likes me too, so I should let him know what I feel so we can both be honest with each other.  Thank you for your help!

I've been running for about 6 months now, mostly on trails, and have been doing some interval training. But lately I've felt so sluggish.  I want to be able to run 10k without dying but I am struggling to get through those first few miles of my runs. Any tips?

He has also gone quiet on social media which made me worry because we used to follow each other and comment on each other’s posts.  I have tried to discuss it with him but he has just told me that he doesn’t want anything serious at the moment and that he wants to take things slow.   I am struggling to accept this and I feel like I need to know why he is not interested in a long term relationship. Is there something wrong with him? Should I give up and move on? What should I do? Any advice would be appreciated!

I don’t want to go out by myself all the time but it is so hard to find people who actually care about me and want to hang out with me. Does anyone else feel like this? title: Ways to communicate with your partner when you are feeling overwhelmed and want to talk about it?
self_text: I’m really struggling to communicate how I feel at the moment. My partner has been working a lot lately, so we don’t get much time for quality conversations. I know they have things on their mind too but I just need to vent sometimes.  I feel like if I start talking about how I am feeling, they will just try to solve the problem for me. Which is great sometimes but not what I need right now. They tend to be very practical and logical which isn't bad but often times I just need someone to listen. If they jump in to fix it, then I shut down completely because I just want to be heard. Any suggestions would be appreciated!!

title: I’m having a baby boy in 4 weeks. What names should I consider?
self_text: I have been working on my name list for the last month, but still haven’t decided on anything.  I am looking for something that is not too popular, or common, and has a masculine vibe to it. I don’t want to be “that” mom with a super trendy name, so if anyone has any suggestions, I would love to hear them. Thank you!

title: Ways to improve my social life?
self_text: I am a shy introvert and tend to stay home more than going out to events or parties, even though i do enjoy socializing with my friends when we meet up. Is there anything i can do to make myself go out more and meet new people?

title: You think you're the only one in love with someone but what if it's not true?
self_text: I don’t know why but every time that I see him, my heart beats faster and I feel like a stupid kid again, watching a cute girl.   I want to be his friend and I can’t stop thinking about him.  He doesn’t even know how much I like him and I am afraid to tell him because I have no idea how he would react to me telling him something so personal.  How should I act around him?

title: I'm so sick of my dad and his wife
self_text: They keep trying to get me to come over for dinner but they always make it about how much money I spend on takeout or that I should be more concerned with getting a job instead of going to school. Like I don't want to talk about money, I just want them to treat me like a person and not an ATM. I have been working hard in school and my grades are good, why do they need to act like I am failing?

title: Ways to say you’re not interested in someone without hurting their feelings?
self_text: As a girl who has been hurt by men for far too long, I wanted to give my advice on how to politely let them know that you are not interested.  1. Don’t be rude or mean; no need to be nasty about it. (No need to insult their appearance, intelligence, skills, etc.)  2. Don't ghost them! That is so disrespectful and cruel.  3. If they ask you out directly, tell them directly that you don’t want to go on a date with them. But if they continue to pursue you after that, just reiterate your point once more.  4. The most important thing is to be polite, respectful, and kind. Even when saying “no,” you should still treat them with respect. It hurts their feelings when people are rude to them. They might try to argue with you about why you shouldn’t have said “no” but stand firm. You aren’t obligated to explain yourself.  5. Be honest. (But always be nice) You can lie, but it doesn't feel good to do that and it won't work out anyway.   I really hope this helps someone!  P.S. This is all coming from an ex who was used for her looks and charm.  Thank you for reading. ❤️ Signed: A woman who wants to protect herself.  Disclaimer: Do not use these tactics as a means of manipulation. These tips are meant to help women say ‘no’ without being rude.

title: I think my bf is texting another girl??
self_text: I feel like he’s texting another girl, he said that if I don’t stop being so clingy, then we will break up. We have been dating for about 6 months now. He said it in a really harsh way and it made me cry but I didn’t want to give him what he wants. So I stopped texting him and just waited for him to call. But he hasn’t called and when I text him he ignores me. Like it’s really hurting me and I don’t know what to do. Is there anything I can do? Can someone help me please!!

Is there any way I can get more information on the company culture before accepting?

title: You just know she's going to try to make you feel guilty about it
self_text: I can’t let her get away with it, the way she has been treating me since my divorce and how she has been trying to get at me. She will not be treated like that anymore. And I have no idea why she would think she could get away with it. So many of us have suffered in silence for so long, and now we are all standing up for ourselves. We deserve respect, and we don’t want anyone to treat us like that ever again. We are not the ones who should be suffering here.

She still texts and says she enjoys our time together, but nothing more. What can I do to tell if she likes me or not?

title: What’s the best way to start a conversation with someone you’re interested in?
self_text: I am an introvert and i hate to just randomly message people on social media because it feels fake, but when i see somebody i like that is very active on some social media platform (like discord or twitter) it can be hard to find the courage to say something, especially if they do not have any mutual friends or anything. So i was wondering what the best approach would be.  I am mostly thinking about Discord for now. I want to make sure my messages are genuine and interesting so that they don't think i am creepy or just trying to get their attention. Any advice would be appreciated!

I would love to spend some time with you, but my mom and dad don't want me to go out so much anymore.  I just wanted to let you know I was thinking about you.  Have a great day!

title: I'm going to be a father, how do I deal with my ex-girlfriend?
self_text: I'm going to be a father in 3 months and I'm not sure how to deal with my ex-girlfriend. We dated for about two years before we broke up. During our time together, she didn't act like her friends told me that she did. We had some issues that we couldn't work out of it. Now that I have news of becoming a father, I don't know if it's worth reaching out to her or what should I say. She was always very supportive of me during our relationship but now that I am having a child, I don't think she would want anything to do with me. Is it worth trying to reach out to her or is it better to just let things go?  Thank you for your input.

title: Is it okay if I don't get to know my husband's friends?
self_text: My husband says that he doesn't want me to be best friends with them but I still think it would be nice to get to know them and maybe hang out once in a while.. What do you guys think?

title: I wish someone would talk to me
self_text: Hi, I’m an adult and I feel pretty lonely sometimes. It feels like everyone has friends or family they can talk to, but I don’t.  I don’t really know how to start a conversation with people. Like, if I see someone on the bus that looks like they might be having a bad day, I just stare at them (which probably makes it worse). If I think of something to say, I overthink it so much that I end up not saying anything at all. I don’t want to bother anyone, but I also don’t want to spend my days in silence.  It’s a weird thing to admit, but I get anxiety when I try to make small talk. It’s like my brain just shuts down and I can’t think of what to say. I’ve tried reading books about social skills, and even practiced some conversations out loud, but nothing seems to work.  I guess what I’m asking is… does anyone else experience this? Any tips for making it easier to talk to strangers?

title: Why are there no women on the side of the road in my city?
self_text: I don’t know what to think about this, but every time I see a car with a woman driving it, she is always alone.  I have been in rural areas and big cities, but never have I seen another woman drive next to me. They all seem to be either stuck in traffic or driving behind other cars. It’s really weird to me. Maybe I am just used to seeing men drive more than women. But still… I find it strange that they never stop for a second to chat with each other. Maybe that’s why they stay behind their cars. Idk, maybe something else is going on. I just wanted to share my thoughts with you guys.

At first I thought it was an accident or something, but then I realized that he was deliberately avoiding me.  I have tried reaching out to him via text and social media, but he has not responded at all. It hurts because I really liked him and now I feel like my feelings for him are meaningless. I am sick of the abuse and want to get rid of her for good but I don’t know how to do it without being threatened or abused. Can anyone give me some advice?

title: Ways to tell someone you’re not interested in them
self_text: I don’t want to hurt their feelings, but they have been flirting with me and now seem to be getting more aggressive when I reject them.  I was just wondering how to do it without making things worse for either of us.  Thank you for the advice!

title: You’re the reason why I can’t get back together with my ex.
self_text: My ex is now in a relationship and it turns out she was doing what I told her to do for years. Turns out my ex is not so bad after all. She has an ex who doesn’t care about her at all. So when they fight, he leaves her to take care of everything on his own. After months and months of being left alone, she finally decided that she can no longer live like that. So she got rid of him and went back to me. But I wasn’t interested anymore because I thought you were better than her. So I didn’t go back to her. Now she wants to come back but I won’t ever be able to go back to her. So if you think that your way is right then don’t tell me how to live my life. And if you want to go back to her then let her do that.  You are the reason why I can’t get back together with my ex.

title: I have a crush on my best friend
self_text: We have been friends for 5 years and we are in the same class. He has told me he likes me but I don’t know if I like him back. How do you find out?

title: I wish my mom would stop texting me about her husband and how much she loves him, but then she doesn’t text me back at all for days.
self_text: I feel like she’s trying to make me feel bad by only texting me when she wants something from me or has a question for me. It feels like she does not care about what I want or need. She can be so quick to text about how happy she is with him, but she won’t even reply to texts if I try to talk to her, it makes me feel like I am being ignored and that she does not love me. She says she loves me, but I don’t think she does because of the way she acts around me. She just tells me what I want to hear, but never actually means it. It is hurting me. She used to call me every day, now she calls me once in a blue moon. I miss having a mother who cares about me. I just wanted to share my feelings here.

title: How to make friends with the same interests as me?
self_text: I really want to have more friends but it’s hard since I don’t know many people who like my interests. I like Minecraft, Roblox, and video games in general. I play a lot of them on Xbox, PC, and Nintendo Switch. I also like anime and manga, mostly action/adventure stuff.  How do you meet people who share your interests? Should you go to conventions? What are some good ways to make friends?

title: What's a good way to get out of the relationship?
self_text: I am currently in an unhealthy, abusive relationship with someone who is using me for money and sex and doesn't care about my feelings at all. She has been gaslighting and manipulating me into doing things I don't want to do for months now and it's starting to feel like there isn't a way to end it peacefully. The only thing that makes me still be with her is because she has some very valuable collectibles and art pieces (which I have no access to) that could potentially make me wealthy if I were to take them. I need to find a way to leave without getting hurt or killed by her and her friends.  I would love to go back to school so that I can learn how to work with computers and earn more money and eventually buy my own property to live on with my family (who are already living in another country). However, I need to get out of this situation first. How do I achieve this?  Any advice?

title: Ways to get over a crush?
self_text: I just got out of a long term relationship and I’m having a hard time getting over my ex. The problem is that we were together for so long that I don’t think it’s possible to forget him completely, he will always be in the back of my mind, but if i focus on other things i can get over him. So here are some ways I have been trying to do in order to get over him:   1) Focus on school and work.   2) Try new hobbies like gaming and sports.  3) Spend more time with friends and family.  4) Go outside as much as possible.   5) Watch movies or read books.  6) Try to make myself happy by doing things that make me happy. But at the end of the day, I still miss him, and sometimes I wish he was still around.   I know I need to move on, but its hard. How did you guys get over your crushes? What tips would you give to someone who is struggling with moving on? Thanks!

title: Did anyone else find that the last time I tried to play a game with my mom, she didn’t respond at all and was just staring at her phone?
self_text: It felt like she didn’t even hear me when I said “let’s play something” or “I want to play something with you”. I had already started playing some random card game on my laptop when I noticed she wasn’t responding and I assumed she was lost in thought, so I just played for a bit longer until she finally responded. When I asked if we could play something together, she stared right at me while staring at her phone and said “sure, whatever” before looking back down at her phone.  Does anyone else have similar experiences where they feel ignored by their parents when trying to do something fun with them?

title: I don’t know what to do with myself anymore.
self_text: I have been feeling really low lately and I don’t even know why. My family thinks it is because of the breakup, but I think it’s something deeper than that. I don’t feel like myself at all. I just want to sleep all day, eat junk food, and not talk to anyone. I don’t even care about my hobbies or friends anymore. It feels like everything has lost its meaning for me.

title: How do you start a conversation with someone?
self_text: I’m really shy, and it’s hard for me to talk to people, especially people I don’t know very well. I tend to just stare at the floor and play with my hair, but sometimes I get bored, so I end up staring at them. They usually think I’m weird or that I’m looking down on them, which is not what I want to happen. So how do you even start a conversation?  I've tried to compliment them once or twice, but they never respond, so I guess they aren’t interested in talking to me. Should I ask them questions? Like, what are their hobbies, what do they do in their free time? What should I say? If they see me staring at them, should I look away? Should I smile?  What if they don’t like me? Is there something wrong with me?  (Edit: I’m a 15-year-old boy.)

title: AITA for telling my friend that she shouldn't date him?
self_text: My friends boyfriend just broke up with her and they are very close so I was there when he told her. He is a really nice guy but he has a lot of anger issues, specifically rage which makes it hard to be around him sometimes.  She came over crying and wanted to talk about it. I said "I think you should dump him, he isn't good for you". She got angry at me and accused me of being toxic. I tried explaining how I think he isn't good for her and how much he hurts her when he gets angry, but she didn't listen.   Now she thinks I am toxic because I told her what I thought and she says I don't have the right to tell her who to date. I'm confused as to why she's mad at me for trying to protect her from someone who might hurt her. Am I the asshole here?

title: I want to know what you guys think about the whole thing
self_text: I just read an article on how men are more likely to be victims of domestic violence than women, and it’s really heartbreaking. It made me realize that a lot of people don’t consider that men can also experience abuse, whether emotional, physical, or psychological. A lot of times, men get dismissed when they report abuse because they aren't seen as being in a position of power. It’s not always about power dynamics, though. Sometimes, it’s about control, manipulation, and intimidation.  I have some friends who went through abusive relationships with men, and they told me how difficult it was for them to be believed. They said that their partners would often gaslight them into thinking they were crazy, and that the police wouldn't take them seriously. In those situations, they felt like they had no one to turn to. I wonder if anyone has ever been in such situation? How did they cope? What advice would they give to someone who is going through something similar?

title: How do you know if your crush likes you?
self_text: I’m having a really hard time figuring out if my crush likes me back. I think we have so much in common, but when we hang out we don’t talk as much and he seems to be uncomfortable around me sometimes.  I can see that he is attracted to me though. Like last night we were watching tv and I went to cuddle him and he pulled away. It wasn’t rude or anything, he just kinda stiffened up and seemed uncomfortable. He did give me a small smile tho.  I also saw him looking at me like 3 times today. When i was walking down the hall he looked at me from his locker and then when i was in class he looked at me across the room.  So what should i do? Do i ask him out? Should i not? What are some signs that he likes me?

title: Ways to get out of a toxic relationship?
self_text: I’m stuck in a very bad place with my current partner and I don’t know how to get out. We have been together for almost 2 years, but it feels like we’ve known each other our whole lives. We have one child (she is 3) that we love very much. She is the only reason why I’m still with him.  I’ve tried talking to her about the issues, but she never seems to listen. Every time I try to express my feelings or concerns, she dismisses me or says that I am too sensitive.   Is there anything I can do? Should I just accept that this is my life and try to make the best of it? Or should I start planning my exit strategy now? How do I protect myself and my child from getting hurt during the process?

title: What's the best way to start a conversation?
self_text: I want to make new friends, but don’t know how to start a conversation with people. I tend to be shy around strangers and find it hard to initiate conversations.  I like gaming (minecraft), watching anime/manga, music (mostly rock and metal) and movies. Also, I enjoy learning about different cultures and languages.  Are there any particular tips or tricks that you can share to help me overcome my shyness?

title: How to play the game when they don't want to play?
self_text: I am a male that is interested in playing the game, but my female friend doesn’t want to play and just wants me to watch her while she plays. It’s frustrating because I have been doing this for years and now I feel like she is using me as a babysitter.  I enjoy watching her play, but it feels weird since I have no say over what we do. Is there a way to get her to play with me or should I just accept the situation?

title: What’s your favourite thing to do on a rainy day?
self_text: Mine is read, play video games and take naps.  What about you guys?

title: Why do guys on here never talk about their feelings?
self_text: I’m just curious, why do guys on here never talk about how they feel? Are you all scared to let your emotions show?  I’ve noticed a lot of guys here don’t ever share their feelings at all, even if it seems like they’re hurting or upset.  I think it would be cool to hear what guys on here are going through and if anyone else notices this too.

title: I don’t know what to do
self_text: My best friend is in a relationship with the guy she always talks about, and she’s been talking about him for years. They had a great time together when they were younger, but now he has moved away. Now it turns out he’s not just talking about her, he’s in love with her. But she doesn’t feel the same way anymore. So, he wants to stay with her and be her boyfriend, but she says she can’t go back to being his girlfriend and doesn’t want him to be her boyfriend. She still loves him, and has feelings for him, but she does not want to have an ongoing relationship with him. The thing is, that she’s also dating someone else, and he’s asking me if I think she should end her current relationship and pursue this one. I’m so confused and can’t figure out what to tell her. If I tell her to end her current relationship, she’ll hate me forever. If I say nothing at all, then she won’t get any help. What would you guys do?

title: I’m going to try and play through a few games I haven’t played in years, but what should I play first?
self_text: I’ve been mostly playing Bethesda games recently (Skyrim, Fallout 4) and while I love them, I need something new to break the cycle of Bethesda games. I was wondering if anyone had any recommendations for me on what game I should start with that will be fun and relatively easy to get into. I don’t have much time to play so anything too long or complex is out.  I also want to make sure it has good writing and characters so it doesn’t feel like just another Bethesda game where everything feels repetitive. I also don’t really care about graphics, as long as it runs well on my PC.

title: How do you start a conversation with someone you have an interest in?
self_text: I’m not very good at starting conversations, so I just wanted to ask for advice on how to start a conversation with someone who has interests similar to mine.  I am always nervous when trying to talk to someone about something I like and then it gets awkward. So I end up shutting down the convo before it begins. If anyone could give me some tips or ideas, that would be amazing!

title: I don't think my partner is attracted to me anymore
self_text: We used to be so close, and now we barely talk and never even touch. He tells me he loves me but it doesn't feel like that anymore.  We have been together for 5 years, and it was a good relationship at first, but recently I think things have changed. It's like he doesn't care about what I do or how I feel. I really want to know if he is still attracted to me. What should I do?

title: What are some good gifts for a guy who likes gaming and anime?
self_text: My little brother is turning 13 in June, so I’m trying to find something he would like. He has a lot of interests (like video games, anime, manga, and sometimes even cosplays), but it’s hard to think of something he would actually enjoy. Any recommendations?

title: Do you think it’s a waste of time to try and get back in touch with someone after a breakup?
self_text: I just had a breakup that really hurt me, I haven’t talked to him since he broke up with me. He has told me on multiple occasions that he wanted to remain friends but he said we both needed space from each other which I understood so I gave him that space for about two weeks and then we started texting again until he said that he felt like there was no point anymore because we were going in different directions. We agreed to not talk anymore after that and I respected his wishes. Now that I have moved on and healed from the breakup, I feel like it would be nice to remain friends with him and if he wants to keep things moving forward or whatever, I don’t mind. However, I also believe that trying to stay friends with an ex is pointless because they’re never going to be the same person as before and sometimes people change too much and grow apart which isn’t something I want to go through again.  I am curious though what do you guys think about trying to stay friends with an ex? Does it work for some people and does it only lead to pain and regret for others? Is it better to let go completely or is there some kind of middle ground?

title: Ways to say “I’m gay” without saying “I’m gay”?
self_text: I am a 16 year old boy, and I am just coming out to my friends and family. There is no need for me to have to explain myself or what it means to be gay, but I sometimes find it difficult to articulate how I feel.  Can you give me some ideas on ways to say “I’m gay” without actually saying “I’m gay”?  Thank you!

title: My crush is a boy and I like him too, but we’re both in the same group of friends?
self_text: It’s kind of awkward because we hang out with the same group of people all the time and he’s always smiling at me when he sees me, even though he doesn’t know about my feelings for him. Should I tell him that I like him or just wait to see if he makes a move on me?  I don’t want to ruin our friendship by telling him that I have feelings for him because I don’t want to make things weird between us.

title: How do you make friends as a shy introvert?
self_text: I’m not good at making new friends, and I don’t really enjoy large groups of people.  I tend to stay home when I’m feeling down or sad because I feel like I might embarrass myself if I went out in public. I also have social anxiety.  Any tips?

title: Can someone explain the game of chess to me?
self_text: I just want to play but I don’t know how

title: What’s your favourite way to spend a day off?
self_text: I am bored, let me know what you enjoy doing in your free time!

title: I don't know what to do with my time
self_text: I have been feeling really down on myself lately and struggling to find things to keep me occupied, so I decided to start an account here in Reddit and thought it might be a good idea to meet some new people while doing something I enjoy.

title: I have a crush on my friend but I don’t want to hurt them
self_text: I really like my friend but I don’t want to ruin our friendship so I decided to keep it in the dark. But I can’t stop thinking about them and I wish they felt the same way as me.  I think we would make good partners because we share many interests and qualities and we both get along well.   But I am afraid that if I tell them how I feel, they will be disgusted or offended and it might end our friendship.  What should I do?

title: I think I’m losing it.
self_text: My husband wants to go out with his buddies every weekend and i want to stay home and play video games or just chill at home. We have a 3 year old son and he needs me for him so i don’t feel like i can just stay home all day. It seems that my husband thinks i am not as fun as he is because we used to do things together when we first met but now he doesn’t seem interested in doing anything that doesn’t involve the guys.  I don’t know how to deal with this situation and feel like i am being pushed out of my relationship. I’m starting to think he may be interested in another woman which would be really bad because i love him and i love our family. What should i do?

title: I’m an introvert, and I don’t like meeting new people in person. How can I make friends?
self_text: I really struggle with making new friends because I’m introverted, so it drains me to socialize. But my family keeps telling me that I should meet new people in real life too. Can anyone give me some tips on how to do that without feeling completely exhausted after a short period of socializing? Also, would it be weird if I told someone that I prefer texting or video calls rather than in-person meetings?
